page.title: 04Colston Bassett, Part One
page.content: Colston Bassett has 50 houses in the village, 20 in the Hall grounds and 14 scattered around the village. Most of the land belongs to the Le Marchant family who no longer live here. The River Smite winds through the village which has many trees, mostly horse chestnuts. The National Trust owns the ancient Market Cross . The population is 223. Of these, 20 work on farms, 18 work locally, there are 36 pensioners, 28 housewives and 76 children under 16. 45 people commute, mostly to Nottingham. The Post Office is the only shop, selling groceries as well. The post box in the wall is marked V.R. Letters are collected twice daily. The bus goes to Nottingham 8 times a day. The Martin Arms pub, unusually, closes on Sundays. {CONTINUED ON PAGE 13.
